GHS.definition: The Globally Harmonized System for Hazard Communication

GHS (BIN).definition: substance classified in a binary manner as Category 1 (sensitizer) or NC

GHS (SUB).definition: substance assigned to one of three classes: 1A sensitizer, 1B sensitizer, or NC.

GHS (BORDER).definition: substance assigned to one of five classes: the three classes used in GHS (SUB) with different criteria (except NC); 1 (sensitizer, but subclassification not possible); NC/1B (substance may or may not be a sensitizer, but 1A can be ruled out)
